name: Introduction to Rocket Propulsion
description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion and rocket engines.

lessons.name: History of Rocketry
lessons.description: A brief history of rocketry and space exploration.

lessons.name: Rocket Propulsion Fundamentals
lessons.description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion.

lessons.name: Rocket Engine Types
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket engines.

name: Fuel and Combustion
description: Understanding rocket fuel, combustion processes, and efficiency.

lessons.name: Rocket Fuel
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket fuels.

lessons.name: Combustion Processes
lessons.description: Understanding combustion processes and efficiency.

lessons.name: Combustion Instability
lessons.description: Understanding combustion instability and mitigation.

name: Nozzle Design
description: Principles of rocket nozzle design and performance optimization.

lessons.name: Nozzle Design
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket nozzles.

lessons.name: Nozzle Performance
lessons.description: Understanding nozzle performance and efficiency.

lessons.name: Nozzle Optimization
lessons.description: Optimizing nozzle design for specific applications.

name: Fundamentals of Aerodynamics
description: Basic aerodynamic concepts and fluid dynamics principles.

lessons.name: Aerodynamic Principles
lessons.description: Basic concepts of aerodynamic forces such as lift, drag, and thrust.

lessons.name: Fluid Dynamics
lessons.description: Study of the behavior of air as a fluid and its impact on rocket and spacecraft design.

lessons.name: Flow Control Techniques
lessons.description: Introduction to techniques for controlling airflow in aerodynamic systems.

name: Subsonic and Supersonic Flow
description: Understanding subsonic and supersonic aerodynamic behaviors.

lessons.name: Subsonic Flow Dynamics
lessons.description: Analyzing airflow at speeds less than the speed of sound and its effects on aircraft.

lessons.name: Supersonic Flow Characteristics
lessons.description: Understanding airflow behavior at speeds greater than sound, including shock waves.

lessons.name: Flow Transition Zones
lessons.description: Examining the transition between subsonic and supersonic flow and its implications for design.

name: Aerodynamic Heating
description: Study of aerodynamic heating and thermal protection systems.

lessons.name: Heat Transfer Mechanisms
lessons.description: Study of different heat transfer methods in aerodynamics, including conduction, convection, and radiation.

lessons.name: Thermal Protection Systems
lessons.description: Understanding the design and materials used to protect spacecraft from extreme temperatures.

lessons.name: Aerodynamic Heating Effects
lessons.description: Examining how heat generated during high-speed flight affects materials and structure.

name: Spacecraft Structural Design
description: Fundamentals of designing spacecraft structures and materials selection.

lessons.name: Structural Material Selection
lessons.description: Overview of materials used in spacecraft construction, including their properties and applications.

lessons.name: Structural Load Analysis
lessons.description: Techniques for analyzing the forces that spacecraft structures will experience during launch and space travel.

lessons.name: Designing for Space Environment
lessons.description: How to design spacecraft structures to withstand the extreme conditions of space, such as radiation and vacuum.

name: Orbital Mechanics
description: Understanding orbital dynamics and mission planning.

lessons.name: Kepler's Laws and Orbits
lessons.description: Introduction to orbital mechanics, including Kepler's laws of planetary motion.

lessons.name: Orbital Transfers
lessons.description: Understanding the techniques used to transfer spacecraft between different orbits (e.g., Hohmann transfer).

lessons.name: Orbital Manuevers
lessons.description: How spacecraft perform orbital maneuvers to change trajectory or adjust orbit.

name: Spacecraft Systems Engineering
description: Overview of spacecraft systems and subsystems engineering.

lessons.name: Systems Integration
lessons.description: Overview of how various spacecraft subsystems work together to ensure mission success.

lessons.name: Subsystem Design and Reliabilty
lessons.description: Focusing on the design and reliability of subsystems like propulsion, power, and communications.

lessons.name: Mission Planning and Systems Engineering
lessons.description: Understanding the role of systems engineering in the planning and execution of spacecraft missions.

name: Hydrocarbons
description: Introduction to the structure, properties, and reactions of alkanes, alkenes, alkynes, and aromatics.

lessons.name: Alkanes and Alkenes
lessons.description: Introduction to the structure, properties, and reactions of alkanes and alkenes.

lessons.name: Aromatic Compounds
lessons.description: Study of aromatic hydrocarbons, their structure, and unique reactions.

lessons.name: Reactions of Hydrocarbons
lessons.description: Overview of key reactions involving alkanes, alkenes, and aromatics, such as addition and substitution reactions.

name: Functional Groups
description: Study of key functional groups, including alcohols, aldehydes, ketones, and carboxylic acids, and their reactivity.

lessons.name: Alcohols and Ethers
lessons.description: Exploration of the structure, properties, and reactions of alcohols and ethers.

lessons.name: Aldehydes and Ketones
lessons.description: Study of carbonyl-containing compounds, their structures, and common reactions.

lessons.name: Carboxylic Acids and Derivatives
lessons.description: Analyzing carboxylic acids and their derivatives, including esterification and decarboxylation reactions.

name: Organic Synthesis and Mechanisms
description: Overview of reaction mechanisms like nucleophilic substitution, elimination, and radical reactions in organic synthesis.

lessons.name: Nucleophilic Substitution Reactions
lessons.description: Introduction to SN1 and SN2 mechanisms and their applications in organic synthesis.

lessons.name: Elimination Reactions
lessons.description: Understanding E1 and E2 elimination mechanisms and their role in forming double bonds.

lessons.name: Radical Reactions
lessons.description: Study of radical mechanisms in organic reactions, including halogenation and polymerization.

name: Coordination Chemistry
description: Study of coordination compounds, metal-ligand bonding, and the geometries of coordination complexes.

lessons.name: Ligands and Coordination Complexes
lessons.description: Understanding coordination compounds, types of ligands, and their bonding to metal centers.

lessons.name: Crystal Field Thoery
lessons.description: Analysis of the splitting of d-orbitals in coordination compounds and its effects on properties.

lessons.name: Applications of Coordination Compounds
lessons.description: Exploring the real-world uses of coordination compounds in catalysis and medicine.

name: Bonding Theories
description: Exploration of Valence Bond and Molecular Orbital theories and their application to inorganic compounds.

lessons.name: Valence Bond Theory
lessons.description: A deep dive into the theory explaining chemical bonding through atomic orbitals.

lessons.name: Molecular Orbital Theory
lessons.description: Study of bonding using molecular orbitals, particularly for diatomic molecules.

lessons.name: Bonding in Metal Complexes
lessons.description: Investigating the bonding characteristics of metals in coordination complexes.

name: Organometallic Chemistry
description: Focus on organometallic compounds, their reactions, and applications in catalysis and materials science.

lessons.name: Metal-Ligand Bonding
lessons.description: Understanding the types of bonds between metals and organic ligands in organometallic compounds.

lessons.name: Reactions of Organometallic Compounds
lessons.description: Analyzing key reactions involving organometallic compounds, such as oxidative addition and reductive elimination.

lessons.name: Applications of Organometallics
lessons.description: Exploration of the role of organometallic compounds in catalysis and materials science.

name: Thermodynamics
description: Introduction to thermodynamics, including enthalpy, entropy, and free energy, and their role in chemical reactions.

lessons.name: Laws of Thermodynamics
lessons.description: Introduction to the four laws of thermodynamics and their implications for chemical reactions.

lessons.name: Enthalpy and Entropy
lessons.description: Understanding the concepts of enthalpy and entropy, and how they relate to spontaneity and energy changes.

lessons.name: Free Energy and Equilibrium
lessons.description: Study of Gibbs free energy, equilibrium constants, and their applications in chemical reactions.

name: Kinetics
description: Study of reaction rates, factors affecting them, and reaction mechanisms.

lessons.name: Reaction Rate Laws
lessons.description: Analyzing the factors that affect the rate of a chemical reaction and determining rate laws.

lessons.name: Reaction Mechanisms
lessons.description: Exploration of reaction mechanisms, including the identification of elementary steps and the role of intermediates.

lessons.name: Catalysis and Enzyme Kinetics
lessons.description: Understanding the role of catalysts and enzymes in accelerating reactions.

name: Quantum Mechanics and Spectroscopy
description: Overview of quantum theory and its application to spectroscopy techniques like NMR and IR for structure determination.

lessons.name: Wave Functions and Schrödinger Equation
lessons.description: Introduction to the Schrödinger equation and the concept of wave functions in quantum mechanics.

lessons.name: Atomic Orbitals and Electron Configuration
lessons.description: Study of atomic orbitals, electron configuration, and the importance of quantum numbers.

lessons.name: Spectroscopy and Molecular Orbitals
lessons.description: Overview of how spectroscopy is used to study molecular orbitals and the electronic structure of molecules.

name: The Elvish Languages
description: Explore the structure, history, and cultural significance of Sindarin and Quenya, the Elvish languages of Middle-earth.

lessons.name: Sindarin: Basic Grammar
lessons.description: Introduction to Sindarin grammar, sentence structure, and common phrases.

lessons.name: Quenya: Phonetics and Vocabulary
lessons.description: Study of Quenya phonetics and building a foundational vocabulary.

lessons.name: Elvish Syntax and Writing
lessons.description: Analysis of Elvish sentence structure and the Tengwar script used in writing.

name: The Dwarvish Language
description: Learn about the unique characteristics of Khuzdul, the secretive language of the Dwarves, and its role in their society.

lessons.name: Khuzdul: Dwarvish Grammar
lessons.description: Overview of Khuzdul grammar and syntax, focusing on its uniqueness in Middle-earth.

lessons.name: The Black Speech of Mordor
lessons.description: Study of the Black Speech, its use in inscriptions, and its role in the power dynamics of Mordor.

lessons.name: Comparative Linguistics of Middle-earth
lessons.description: Exploring the relationships and differences between the languages of Elves, Dwarves, and Men.

name: The Black Speech of Mordor
description: Study the Black Speech, its creation by Sauron, and its use in the dark history of Mordor and the forces of evil.

lessons.name: Elvish Inscriptions in Middle-earth
lessons.description: Study of famous Elvish inscriptions, their meaning, and cultural significance.

lessons.name: Dwarvish and Other Ancient Scripts
lessons.description: Analysis of Dwarvish inscriptions and other historical writings found throughout Middle-earth.

lessons.name: The Role of Language in Middle-earth Lore
lessons.description: Exploring the importance of language and writing in the mythos and history of Middle-earth.

name: Diplomatic Foundations
description: Examine the foundations of diplomacy between the different species of Middle-earth, focusing on leadership and alliances.

lessons.name: The Role of Elves in Middle-earth Politics
lessons.description: Study of Elven diplomacy, their alliances, and their interactions with other races.

lessons.name: The Elven Council: Politics and Power
lessons.description: Overview of the councils, such as the White Council, and their impact on the fate of Middle-earth.

lessons.name: Elven Relations with Dwarves and Men
lessons.description: Examination of the delicate relationships between Elves and other races, particularly Dwarves and Men.

name: Conflict and Resolution
description: Study key historical conflicts, such as the War of the Ring, and how diplomacy played a role in their resolution.

lessons.name: Human Kingdoms and their Politics
lessons.description: Analysis of the political structures of Men, focusing on kingdoms like Gondor and Rohan.

lessons.name: The Role of Wizards in Human Diplomacy
lessons.description: Exploring the influence of Wizards, particularly Gandalf, on human kingdoms and diplomacy.

lessons.name: Human-Dwarven Alliances
lessons.description: Study of the historical and political alliances between Men and Dwarves, particularly during the War of the Ring.

name: The Council of Elrond
description: Analyze the diplomatic dynamics at the Council of Elrond, a pivotal event in Middle-earth’s history of inter-species negotiation.

lessons.name: Dwarvish Politics and Governance
lessons.description: Overview of the political systems and alliances within Dwarven societies.

lessons.name: The Role of Dwarves in the War of the Ring
lessons.description: Study of Dwarven participation in key events of the War of the Ring and their diplomatic strategies.

lessons.name: Inter-Species Conflict and Cooperation
lessons.description: Analyzing the challenges and successes of inter-species diplomacy in Middle-earth, particularly between Elves, Men, and Dwarves.
